studies.title: Efficacy and Safety of Novel Antibody Treatment for Early-Stage Rheumatoid Arthritis
studies.officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of IL-17 Inhibition in Early-Stage Rheumatoid Arthritis
studies.description: This study aims to evaluate the efficacy and safety of an IL-17 antagonist monoclonal antibody in patients with early-stage rheumatoid arthritis who have not received prior biologic therapy.
studies.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 18-75 years
- Diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis according to ACR/EULAR 2010 criteria
- Disease duration <2 years
- Active disease defined as DAS28-CRP ≥3.2
- Inadequate response to at least one conventional DMARD

Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous exposure to any biologic DMARD
- History of tuberculosis or positive IGRA test
- Live vaccines within 4 weeks prior to randomization
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
- Significant comorbid conditions

studies.title: Novel microbiome therapy for irritable bowel syndrome
studies.officialTitle: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Fecal Microbiota Transplantation for the Treatment of Irritable Bowel Syndrome With Diarrhea
studies.description: This clinical trial evaluates the efficacy of fecal microbiota transplantation in patients with diarrhea-predominant irritable bowel syndrome compared to placebo. The primary outcome is the proportion of patients who achieve clinical response at 12 weeks.
studies.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 18-65 years
- Rome IV criteria for IBS-D
- Symptoms for at least 6 months
- Failure of at least two conventional therapies
- Willing to discontinue probiotics 4 weeks before screening

Exclusion Criteria:
- History of inflammatory bowel disease
- Celiac disease
- Major gastrointestinal surgery
- Antibiotic use within 3 months of screening
- Severe psychiatric disorders
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding

studies.title: Multi-center assessment of novel gene therapy for hemophilia A
studies.officialTitle: A Phase 1/2, Open-Label, Dose-Escalation Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of a Novel AAV-Based Gene Therapy in Adult Patients with Severe Hemophilia A
studies.description: This is a first-in-human, multi-center, open-label study designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of an adeno-associated virus (AAV) vector expressing human Factor VIII in patients with severe hemophilia A. Participants will receive a single intravenous infusion of the investigational gene therapy at escalating doses.
studies.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males aged 18-65 years
- Severe hemophilia A (FVIII activity <1%)
- History of ≥150 exposure days to FVIII products
- No history of FVIII inhibitors
- No evidence of liver disease
- Negative for anti-AAV antibodies

Exclusion Criteria:
- History of thromboembolic events
- HIV positive with CD4 count <200 cells/μL
- Active hepatitis B or C infection
- Prior gene therapy or liver transplantation
- Participation in another interventional study within 3 months

studies.title: Novel treatment for treatment-resistant depression in older adults
studies.officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Active-Controlled Study of a Novel NMDA Receptor Modulator in Elderly Patients with Treatment-Resistant Depression
studies.sponsor: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
studies.description: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of a novel NMDA receptor modulator in elderly patients with treatment-resistant depression, compared to standard of care. The primary outcome is change in Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score at 4 weeks.
studies.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 65-85 years
- Major Depressive Disorder (DSM-5 criteria)
- Inadequate response to ≥2 antidepressants from different classes
- MADRS score ≥26 at screening and baseline
- Mini-Mental State Examination score ≥24

Exclusion Criteria:
- History of bipolar disorder or psychotic disorders
- Current substance use disorder
- Clinically significant neurological disorders
- History of seizure disorder
- Suicidal ideation with intent within 6 months
- Unstable medical conditions

studies.title: Efficacy of precision oncology approach for advanced breast cancer
studies.officialTitle: A Randomized Phase 3 Trial Comparing Standard of Care versus Genomically-Directed Therapy Selection in Patients with HR+/HER2- Metastatic Breast Cancer
studies.drugName: Multiple targeted therapies based on genomic profiling
studies.description: This trial compares standard therapy selection versus genomically-directed therapy selection in patients with hormone receptor-positive, HER2-negative metastatic breast cancer. Patients in the experimental arm will receive treatment based on comprehensive genomic profiling results.
studies.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged ≥18 years
- Histologically confirmed HR+/HER2- advanced breast cancer
- Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Progression on or after at least one line of endocrine therapy

Exclusion Criteria:
- Brain metastases unless treated and stable
- Prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease
- Active second malignancy
- Significant cardiovascular disease
- Uncontrolled intercurrent illness

studies.title: Novel immunotherapy combination for advanced melanoma
studies.officialTitle: A Randomized, Open-Label Phase 2 Study of Anti-LAG-3 Antibody in Combination with Pembrolizumab in Patients with Advanced Melanoma who Progressed on Anti-PD-1 Therapy
studies.description: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of an anti-LAG-3 antibody in combination with pembrolizumab in patients with advanced melanoma who progressed on prior anti-PD-1 therapy. The primary endpoint is objective response rate per RECIST v1.1.
studies.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged ≥18 years
- Histologically confirmed unresectable stage III or IV melanoma
- Documented progression on anti-PD-1 therapy
- At least one measurable lesion per RECIST v1.1
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function

Exclusion Criteria:
- Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment
- Prior anti-LAG-3 therapy
- Untreated CNS metastases
- History of pneumonitis
- Active infection requiring therapy
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding

studies.title: Novel therapy for Duchenne muscular dystrophy
studies.officialTitle: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety, Efficacy, and Pharmacokinetics of a Novel Utrophin Modulator in Ambulatory Boys with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
studies.description: This study evaluates the safety and efficacy of a novel utrophin modulator in ambulatory boys with Duchenne muscular dystrophy. The primary outcome is change in the North Star Ambulatory Assessment (NSAA) total score at 48 weeks.
studies.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Boys aged 5-12 years
- Genetically confirmed diagnosis of DMD
- Able to walk ≥75 meters unassisted in 6-minute walk test
- Stable regimen of corticosteroids for ≥6 months
- North Star Ambulatory Assessment score ≥8

Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of investigational drugs within 3 months
- Prior gene therapy or cell-based therapy
- Planned or anticipated surgery during study
- Clinically significant cardiac or pulmonary dysfunction
- Inability to comply with study procedures

studies.title: Novel CRISPR-based therapy for cystic fibrosis
studies.officialTitle: A Phase 1, Open-Label, Dose-Escalating Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of CRISPR/Cas9-Mediated Gene Editing Delivered via Lipid Nanoparticles in Adult Patients with Cystic Fibrosis
studies.description: This is a first-in-human study evaluating the safety and preliminary efficacy of a CRISPR/Cas9 gene editing therapy delivered via lipid nanoparticles to correct the most common CFTR mutation (F508del) in patients with cystic fibrosis. The therapy is administered via nebulization.
studies.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 18-40 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of CF with homozygous F508del mutation
- FEV1 ≥40% and ≤90% predicted
- Clinically stable without pulmonary exacerbation for 4 weeks
- Willing to discontinue CFTR modulators 4 weeks prior to dosing

Exclusion Criteria:
- Active pulmonary infection with B. cepacia or M. abscessus
- Significant hemoptysis (>60 mL) within 6 months
- History of solid organ transplantation
- Abnormal liver function (ALT or AST >3x ULN)
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
- Current smoker or vaping

studies.title: Novel therapy for treatment-resistant hypertension
studies.officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of a Novel Dual Endothelin Receptor Antagonist in Patients with Treatment-Resistant Hypertension
studies.description: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of a novel dual endothelin receptor antagonist in patients with treatment-resistant hypertension. The primary endpoint is change from baseline in mean 24-hour ambulatory systolic blood pressure at 12 weeks.
studies.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 18-75 years
- Diagnosis of true treatment-resistant hypertension
- Office systolic BP ≥140 mmHg despite use of ≥3 antihypertensive medications
- Mean 24-hour ambulatory systolic BP ≥130 mmHg during screening
- Stable medication regimen for ≥4 weeks

Exclusion Criteria:
- Secondary hypertension
- Severe renal impairment (eGFR <30 mL/min/1.73m²)
- Significant valvular heart disease
- History of heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
- Clinically significant abnormalities on screening ECG
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding

studies.title: Novel treatment for severe eosinophilic asthma
studies.officialTitle: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of a Novel Anti-TSLP Monoclonal Antibody in Adults with Severe Eosinophilic Asthma
studies.description: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of a novel anti-TSLP monoclonal antibody in adults with severe eosinophilic asthma. The primary endpoint is the annualized rate of asthma exacerbations over 52 weeks of treatment.
studies.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 18-75 years
- Physician-diagnosed asthma for ≥2 years
- Blood eosinophil count ≥300 cells/μL within past 12 months
- ACQ-6 score ≥1.5 at screening
- Pre-bronchodilator FEV1 <80% predicted
- ≥2 documented asthma exacerbations requiring systemic corticosteroids in the past 12 months
- Maintenance treatment with high-dose ICS plus LABA

Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of COPD or other significant lung disease
- Current smoker or former smoker with ≥10 pack-years
- Parasitic infection within past 6 months
- Clinically significant comorbidity
- Prior biologic therapy for asthma within washout period
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
